results.title: Exenatide Attenuates Obesity-Induced Mitochondrial Dysfunction by Activating SIRT1 in Renal Tubular Cells
results.text_hl: As we had observed obvious pathological changes in TECs in HFD-@SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Exenatide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077270 @@@exenatide@@@ treatment had a better outcome in TECs than @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, we further tested @GENE_HAVCR1 @GENE_171283 @@@KIM-1@@@ protein, the renal @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea_5_With_Tufting_Enteropathy_Congenital</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C567703 @@@TECs injury@@@ marker, the result indicated that @CHEMICAL_Exenatide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077270 @@@exenatide@@@, but not @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, ameliorated the HFD-mediated @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea_5_With_Tufting_Enteropathy_Congenital</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C567703 @@@TECs injury@@@ (Figures 3E, G), In summary, our findings suggest that @CHEMICAL_Exenatide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077270 @@@exenatide@@@ prevents the HFD-mediated @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea_5_With_Tufting_Enteropathy_Congenital</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C567703 @@@TECs injury@@@, concomitantly restore @GENE_SIRT1 @GENE_93759 @@@SIRT1@@@ and @GENE_PPARGC1A @GENE_19017 @@@PGC-1alpha@@@ expression.

citations.NLM: Wang Y, He W, Wei W, Mei X, Yang M, Wang Y. Exenatide Attenuates Obesity-Induced Mitochondrial Dysfunction by Activating SIRT1 in Renal Tubular Cells Front Endocrinol (Lausanne). 2021;12():622737. PMID: 34434166
